the feudal system, the social and land-owning system of western Europe in the Middle Ages or of any society that is organized according to rank: He furthered some of the ideals of the French Revolution by abolishing feudalism. the shift from feudalism to capitalism in Europe during the 18th and 19th centuries See
feudal
More examplesFewer examples Feudalism was the process by which individuals gave up their personal liberties in return for protection.Marxist theory states that feudalism leads to capitalism and then socialism.Land reform was the only way of ensuring an end to feudalism.
